channel.title: How do I draw on the canvas?
channel.description:
How do I draw on the canvas?
I have seen lots of scripts do it, but I can't figure it out. I keep trying, but I need some kind of straight forward tutorial to figure it out. If anyone could just show me real quick, that would be great. Thanks. :)

item.title: How do I draw on the canvas?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:6, topic:30562”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=44709.msg545163#msg545163 date=1164823756]
have a look at the scar scripts section.
[/quote]
like I said above, I keep trying to use scripts to help me with the whole canvas thing, but there’s like a coding void and I just totallys crew it up somehow and I have no idea how.

I smell another awesome idea from Ron

You’ll see!

I don’t know nothing about Canvases… But, Yakman does. …and he made this great tutorial to Villu-Reborn(SRL) forums. HERE it is… That might help you. Actually, I am pretty sure it does.

Remember to thank Yakman about it!

Hey thanks a lot Janilabo! I’ll check it out and I will thank yakman. He’s a good coder.

Pretty simple:

[scar]program New;
const
width = 300;
height = 300;
var
dbg,buffer: TCanvas;
bmp: Integer;
begin
//Make dummy bitmap and get the canvas (since SCAR can’t just create 'em, lol)
bmp:= BitmapFromString(width,height,#0);
buffer:= GetBitmapCanvas(bmp);
//Display it and get handle
DisplayDebugImgWindow(width,height);
dbg:= GetDebugCanvas;

//Draw to buffer then copy to debug canvas
buffer.Brush.Color:= clWhite;
buffer.Pen.Color := clRed;
buffer.Rectangle(10,10,width-10,height-10);
CopyCanvas(buffer,dbg,0,0,width,height,0,0,width,height);
end.[/scar]
Buffer usually only needed when drawing lots of things.
I’ve only used it once when making my sphere thingy:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,34517.0.html

Yes!!! That’s exactly what I needed. I’ll look more into it, using that tutorial Janilabo suggested. Thanks everybody.

~Ron[/quote]

Sorry, I mean scar 2.03\scripts\test sorry lol.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I draw on the canvas?

have a look at the scar scripts section.

like I said above, I keep trying to use scripts to help me with the whole canvas thing, but there’s like a coding void and I just totallys crew it up somehow and I have no idea how.

N4TH4N:

I smell another awesome idea from Ron

You’ll see!

[quote=“Janilabo, post:2, topic:30562”]I don’t know nothing about Canvases… But, Yakman does. …and he made this great tutorial to Villu-Reborn(SRL) forums. HERE it is… That might help you. Actually, I am pretty sure it does.

Remember to thank Yakman about it! :)[/quote]
Hey thanks a lot Janilabo! I’ll check it out and I will thank yakman. He’s a good coder.

[quote=“cruel, post:4, topic:30562”]Pretty simple:

[scar]program New;
const
width = 300;
height = 300;
var
dbg,buffer: TCanvas;
bmp: Integer;
begin
//Make dummy bitmap and get the canvas (since SCAR can’t just create 'em, lol)
bmp:= BitmapFromString(width,height,#0);
buffer:= GetBitmapCanvas(bmp);
//Display it and get handle
DisplayDebugImgWindow(width,height);
dbg:= GetDebugCanvas;

//Draw to buffer then copy to debug canvas
buffer.Brush.Color:= clWhite;
buffer.Pen.Color := clRed;
buffer.Rectangle(10,10,width-10,height-10);
CopyCanvas(buffer,dbg,0,0,width,height,0,0,width,height);
end.[/scar]
Buffer usually only needed when drawing lots of things.
I’ve only used it once when making my sphere thingy:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,34517.0.html[/quote]
Yes!!! That’s exactly what I needed. I’ll look more into it, using that tutorial Janilabo suggested. Thanks everybody.

~Ron

item.title: How do I draw on the canvas?
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Pretty simple:

[scar]program New;
const
width = 300;
height = 300;
var
dbg,buffer: TCanvas;
bmp: Integer;
begin
//Make dummy bitmap and get the canvas (since SCAR can’t just create 'em, lol)
bmp:= BitmapFromString(width,height,#0);
buffer:= GetBitmapCanvas(bmp);
//Display it and get handle
DisplayDebugImgWindow(width,height);
dbg:= GetDebugCanvas;

//Draw to buffer then copy to debug canvas
buffer.Brush.Color:= clWhite;
buffer.Pen.Color := clRed;
buffer.Rectangle(10,10,width-10,height-10);
CopyCanvas(buffer,dbg,0,0,width,height,0,0,width,height);
end.[/scar]
Buffer usually only needed when drawing lots of things.
I’ve only used it once when making my sphere thingy:
